title: Key Ariane 6 test rescheduled for November
summary: The European Space Agency said Oct. 19 it has rescheduled a long-duration static-fire test of the Ariane 6 rocket for late November, after a major meeting of European government officials where support for the rocket will be on the agenda.

title: Latitude Double Factory Floor Space
summary:
French launch startup Latitude has doubled its factory floor space in preparation for the first flight of its Zephyr launch vehicle. Latitude was founded in 2019 and initially operated out of Paris before moving to its current home in Reims in 2020. The company is developing Zephyr, a two-stage 17-metre tall launch vehicle that is […]
The post Latitude Double Factory Floor Space appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: U.S. Space Force seeks to work closer with allies in face of shared threats
summary: The procurement arm of the U.S. Space Force is making a major push to work more closely with allies abroad and is pressing the Pentagon to adjust classification policies to allow for more open sharing of information with trusted international partners.

title: UK funds surveillance satellite replacement lost in Virgin Orbit failure
summary: The U.K. is funding nearly half the cost of replacing the government-backed cubesat that British maritime surveillance venture Horizon Technologies lost in January in Virgin Orbit’s final launch attempt before bankruptcy.

title: ESA Pushes Ahead with Ariane 6 Testing
summary:
ESA announced 19 October that it had adapted the Ariane 6 testing schedule to enable teams to continue to tick off key milestones while work on a Thrust Vector Control (TVC) anomaly continues. The first hot fire test of an Ariane 6 core stage was completed on 18 July. Following that test, as teams worked […]
